intro: Acroclinium multicaule, commonly known as the clustered acroclinium, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in wetlands and marshy areas, thriving in moist, sandy soils. It has opposite, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences. Acroclinium multicaule is often found in swampy habitats and is considered a rare and endangered species in many parts of its range.
